description: Unleash your rhythm and style in the ultimate street dance battle. From hip-hop to heavy hitting beats, show us your best moves and claim the streets.
name: Street Dance
rules: 1. Eligibility: The event is open to all registered college students. A valid college ID is mandatory.
2. Time Limit: Solo: Maximum 2.5 minutes and Group: Maximum 3.5 minutes
3. Exceeding the time limit may lead to disqualification.
4. Dance Style: Any dance style is allowed.
5. Reporting Time: Teams must report at least 30 minutes before their scheduled performance time.
6. Criteria : students are not permitted to select items songs for street dance; only decent and pre-approved content is allowed.

description: A celebration of culture and storytelling through dance. Bring your traditions or creative themes to life on the big stage.
name: Theme Dance / Folk Dance
rules: 1. Folk Dance - The performance duration must be exactly 3 minutes.
2. Theme Dance - The performance duration should be between 7 to 8 minutes.
3. Each team must consist of a minimum of 12 participants and a maximum of 15 participants for Theme Dance.
4. Teams exceeding or falling short of the specified participant limit may be disqualified.
5. Exceeding the time limit may lead to negative marking or disqualification.
6. Authentic costumes encouraged
shortDescription: Traditional and themed dance performances celebrating diversity

description: Strut your stuff and showcase the latest trends or avant-garde designs. The ramp is yours to command.
name: Fashion Show
rules: 3 rounds minimum
Theme must be innovative
15-20 min show duration
shortDescription: Ramp walk showcase with creative themes and styling

description: Test your knowledge of Indian traditions and showcase your cultural roots in this unique hybrid competition.
name: Battle of Tradition
rules: 1. Participants must be dressed in traditional attire that represents their culture, heritage, or region.
2. Costumes should be decent, respectful, and culturally appropriate.
3. The walk should reflect grace, confidence, and cultural elegance.
4. The use of props is permitted only if they are safe and relevant to the traditional theme.
5. Participants must follow the allocated time limit. Exceeding time may result in negative marking or disqualification.
6. Judging criteria will include traditional attire, confidence, posture, expressions, and overall presentation.
7. Participants are expected to maintain discipline and sportsmanship throughout the event.
8. The judges' and organizers' decisions shall be final and binding.

description: Let your voice be heard. From classical to pop, solo or duet, the microphone awaits your melody.
name: Singing (Solo/Duet)
rules: 1. Time for solo singing is 3.5 minutes and for duet 4 minutes.
2. Only karaoke is allowed.
3. No mobile phones or printed copies allowed. Memorize your lyrics.
4. Languages allowed: Hindi, Marathi, and English.
5. Backing track/music system will be provided.
6. Judges' decision will be final and binding.

description: Transform a blank wall into a masterpiece. Express your creativity on a grand scale.
name: Wall Painting
rules: 1. Maximum 4 members are allowed in a group.
2. 6 basic colors will be provided to participants.
3. Participants will have to bring their own brushes according to their requirement.
4. Wall size will be approximately 5*5 ft.
5. If the participants want to use sprays, they can bring their own.
6. Participants need to provide rough sketches at time of registration.
7. Entry Fee: ₹600 per group of 4
shortDescription: Large-scale artistic expression on designated walls

description: Short boundaries, fast pace, and intense action. Box cricket is cricket reimagined for thrill.
name: Box Cricket
rules: 1. Each team consists of 6 players.
2. Limited overs per match (4 overs).
3. Under arm bowling is allowed.
4. NO LBW (Leg Before Wicket).
5. Soft ball is utilized.
shortDescription: Indoor cricket tournament with compact format

description: Cook up a storm! Create delicious global street food dishes under time pressure.
name: Global Street Master Chef
rules: 1. Students have to bring their own ingredients.
2. 30 minutes of time will be provided for preparing the dish including presentation.
3. Use of flames, inductions, and oven is not allowed.
4. Students are allowed to be in a group of maximum 2 people.
shortDescription: Outdoor cooking competition with international cuisines

description: A gallery of creativity. Display your best works for the college to admire.
name: Art Exhibition
rules: 1. All arts must be original.
2. Everything should be handmade.
3. Participants must arrange their artwork at the allotted space.
4. Each participant must prepare the artwork at home; no artwork will be created on the competition day.
5. Judges' decision will be final and binding.
shortDescription: Display of paintings, sculptures, and mixed media art

description: Turn faces into living canvases. Show off your painting skills on a unique medium.
name: Face Painting
rules: 1. Participants must bring their own face painting materials, including colors, brushes, sponges, wipes, and mirrors.
2. Only skin-safe, non-toxic, and washable colors are allowed. Use of harmful or permanent paints is strictly prohibited.
3. Time limit will be strictly followed. Participants must complete their artwork within the given time.
4. Theme (if any) will be announced on the spot and must be followed.
5. Models must be arranged by the participants themselves.
6. Use of offensive, inappropriate, or political content in designs is strictly prohibited.
7. Participants must maintain cleanliness at their workstation and dispose of waste responsibly.
8. Judges' decision will be final and binding.
9. Any form of misconduct or violation of rules may lead to immediate disqualification.
shortDescription: Live face art demonstration and competition

description: Design with a purpose. Create impactful posters to spread awareness on social issues.
name: Poster Making
rules: 1. The competition is open for individual participation only.
2. Each participant must prepare the poster at home; no poster will be created on the competition day.
3. Only hand-drawn posters are allowed; digital posters or printouts are not permitted.
4. The poster must be original and strictly based on the given theme.
5. Plagiarism is strictly prohibited and will lead to disqualification.
6. The poster must be made on A3/A2 chart paper as specified by the organizers.
7. Name, Class, Roll Number, and Branch must be written on the front side at the bottom-right corner.
8. The poster must be submitted on the specified date and time; late submissions will not be accepted.
9. Posters will be judged based on creativity, relevance to the theme, clarity of message, and overall presentation.
10. The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

description: Follow the clues, solve the riddles, and race against time to find the hidden treasure.
name: Treasure Hunt
rules: 1. Players must stay in designated area. Leaving the area leads to disqualification.
2. There will be time limit for each round.
3. Solve clues in order to proceed.
4. No one can hide other people's clues.
5. First team to finish wins the treasure hunt.

description: Got a hidden talent? Magic, juggling, mimicry? This is your stage to shine.
name: Talent Hunt
rules: 1. Performance length should be 3-4 minutes.
2. Bring your own props, if required.
3. All performances should maintain decorum.
4. Any talent is allowed.
5. Judged on originality and presentation.
shortDescription: Open platform for unique talents and skills

description: Speak your heart out. Poetry, comedy, or storytelling - the mic is open.
name: Open Mic
rules: 1. Time limit should not exceed 3-4 minutes.
2. Be respectful to the other audience.
3. Original content preferred.
4. Maintain PG-13 rating (no explicit content).
5. Judges' decision will be final and binding.
